name: Pelham Bay Park Forest Restoration
description: Volunteer with the Stewardship Team to protect the forested areas in Pelham Bay Park! Volunteers will contribute to ongoing restoration work and learn the importance of species diversity to ecosystem health.
address: Orchard Beach Parking Lot, New York, NY

name: It's My Park at Asser Levy Park
description: Volunteer with Friends of Asser Levy Park to beautify Asser Levy Park.

description: Volunteer with Friends of Asser Levy Park to beautify Asser Levy Park.

description: Free Public Sunday Programs-Free programs are available on a first-come, first-served basis. Morning program registration takes place from 9:30am-10:00am. Please dress appropriately.
address: Alley Pond Adventure Course, New York, NY

name: Insect Exploration Hunt
description: Join the Urban Park Rangers as we explore the park’s looking for insects such as ants, wasps, beetles, butterflies, mantids and many more.
address: Oakland Lake, New York, NY

name: Insect Exploration Hunt
description: Join the Urban Park Rangers as we explore the park’s looking for insects such as ants, wasps, beetles, butterflies, mantids and many more.
address: Oakland Lake, New York, NY

description: Volunteer with Stuyvesant Park Gardeners to clean up, weed, and prune at Stuyvesant Square.
address: Stuyvesant Square - east fountain, New York, NY

name: Urban Farm Volunteers
description: Volunteer with our team to manage our one-acre Urban Farm! Whether you are new to our Farm or have been a tried-and-true weekly volunteer, come and join us on the Farm.
address: Urban Farm, New York, NY

name: Archery
description: Learn the art of archery with free lessons taught by our expert Urban Park Rangers at our archery range in Willowbrook Park on Staten Island. Registration opens Wednesday May 31
address: Archery Field Parking Lot, New York, NY

name: Urban Farm Open Hours
description: All are welcome at the Urban Farm for self-guided exploration. Discover an abundant variety of fruits and vegetables, an active composting system, and a Tot Lot.
address: Urban Farm, New York, NY

name: Family Art Project: Magical Mushroom Caps
description: Design your own Mushroom “cap” (literally) to shed light on the important decomposers we can find in New York during the spring and summer.
address: Wave Hill House, New York, NY

name: Seed Farming with NYC Parks
description: Join the Greenbelt Native Plant Center’s Seed Increase Program (SIP) to help plant new seed plots at our Floyd Bennett Field native seed farm!
address: Floyd Bennett Field, New York, NY

name: Ranger Games
description: Spend an afternoon of fun with the Urban Park Rangers playing and learning new and exciting nature themed games.
address: Entrance - West 106th Street and Central Park West, New York, NY

description: Volunteer with our team to manage our one-acre Urban Farm! Whether you are new to our Farm or have been a tried-and-true weekly volunteer, come and join us on the Farm.
address: Urban Farm, New York, NY

name: Cardio Sculpt
description: This cardio workout consists of functional movement exercises designed to make daily activities easier to perform.

name: Beginner Yoga
description: Connect with yourself in Beginner Yoga, a class to be enjoyed by all.
address: Sobelsohn Playground, New York, NY

name: Zumba
description: Zumba is a fusion of Latin, International and popular music dance themes creating a dynamic, exciting, effective fitness system!

address: Ballfields, New York, NY

name: Mad Science presents "The Summertime Rocket Show"
description:
Take to the skies as this introduction to rocketry explains how and why rockets fly. You’ll witness real model rocket launches that soar several hundreds of feet into the air and deploy parachutes for their return.

Sponsored by Council Member Lynn Schulman
address: Sobelsohn Playground, New York, NY

name: Beginner Fishing
description: Our experienced Rangers teach the ethics of fishing and the ecology of our waterways. All equipment will be provided. Recommended for ages 8 and older.
address: Crotona Nature Center, New York, NY

name: Tree Wonder
description: Gather on Sundays in Washington Square Park to wonder and draw the English Elm, the oldest tree in Manhattan.
address: Northwest Corner Seating Area, New York, NY

name: Birding: Shorebird Families
description: Birding programs are appropriate for all skill levels and beginners are welcome. Learn more about plovers, terns, oystercatchers and other shorebirds that nest on the beach shoreline.

name: Dance Fitness
description: Dance Fitness is a creative workout that fuses dance and aerobics.
address: Owl's Head Park Playground, New York, NY

description: Join the Urban Park Rangers in a meditative walk through Prospect Park. Make a nature journal while practicing being present through creative endeavors.

name: Dance Fitness
description: Dance Fitness is a creative workout that fuses dance and aerobics.

description: Join artist Tasha Dougé and the Lewis Latimer House Museum for a series of interactive STEAM activities to illuminate history!
